snippet: In the N.F.L. players can outrank coaches, while in college, the head coach frequently has more power than the star quarterback, the athletic director and the university president.
abstract: Decision by Jim Harbaugh, one of most successful NFL coaches, to leave league to coach University of Michigan football team points to changing relationship between college and professional football; college football has become more popular, and thus more lucrative; in addition, many coaches find level of control they have over all aspects of team is much greater in college football than it is in NFL.
lead_paragraph: In the N.F.L. players can outrank coaches, while in college, the head coach frequently has more power than the star quarterback, the athletic director and the university president.

headline.main: N.F.L. Coaches Now Reach for Next Level: College
headline.print_headline: Pro Coaches Now Reach for Next Level: College
